instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_ON_OFF: What is SMC_ON_OFF? SMC_ONOFF tells the computer that the power button has been pressed..

threads.title: 00426 shuts down with Trackpad plugged in
threads.message: This was working fine. Then shut down and wouldn't stay on. i realized it will only stay on with trackpad unplugged. I tried replacing Trackpad and the TP cable. Replaced <CHIP>U4850</CHIP>.  Then noticed something pulling down SMC <SIGNAL>ON_OFF</SIGNAL> when trackpad plugged in. Removed <CAPACITOR>C4810</CAPACITOR>. Checked <RESISTOR>R4810</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5170</RESISTOR>. Replaced <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and the SMC. It still shuts down after about 8 seconds and restarts UNLESS I unplug the trackpad.

threads.title: 00426 shuts down with Trackpad plugged in
threads.message:
What is actual <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> level, w/ and w/o trackpad connected?
Why did you replece mentioned components, if the problem appeared ONLY with trackpad connected?

threads.title: 00426 shuts down with Trackpad plugged in
00426 shuts down with Trackpad plugged in
threads.message: I tried at least 3 new batteries and a used original but then realized <SIGNAL>SMC_ON_OFF</SIGNAL> was being pulled down. However, I just realized that something I changed of the previous fixed the <SIGNAL>SMC_ON_OFF</SIGNAL> issue and  in addition a new battery has now solved it from rebooting.
